title: Kinograte
text: Kinograte used network-based integration multi-omics datasets. Kinograte designed utilize prize-collecting Steiner forest (PCSF) algorithm. case, goal PCSF algorithm identify simplified sub network representative disease chemical perturbagen.

title: Kinograte
text: , present simple example use kinograte using three omic datasets (RNASeq, Proteomics, Kinomics). package comes bundled datasets used try package. datasets used example.

title: Kinograte
text: input data kinograte follow format differential analysis output performed standard analytic packages typically consist three main columns: (gene protein symbol, log2 fold change (LFC), pvalue). use gene protein symbol feature identifier either LFC pvalue metric score rank genes/proteins.

title: Kinograte
text: First, percentile rank features omic dataset:
code: # rank RNASeq based on LFC rnaseq_example_ranked <- percentile_rank(rnaseq_example, `Gene name`, LFC)  reactable(rnaseq_example_ranked)

title: Kinograte
text: Next, can extract top hits omic dataset. using standrized scores main metric set threshold (threshold can adjusted):

title: Kinograte
text: Next, combine top ranked features omic dataset. combined dataframe used input network-based integration function:

title: Kinograte
text: use combined dataframe integrate omics datasets utilizing PCSF algorithm generate integrated biological network using built-protein-protein interaction (PPI) dataset:
code: # note: the ppi_network can be replcaed with a user-provided ppi network file kinograte_res  <- kinograte(combined_df, ppi_network = ppi_network_example, cluster = T) #>   90.57% of your terminal nodes are included in the interactome #>   Solving the PCSF by adding random noise to the edge costs...

title: Kinograte
text: visualize integrated network, use visualize_network function: can also add options dropdown menu:
code: visualize_network(nodes = kinograte_res$nodes, edges = kinograte_res$edges,                    cluster_df = kinograte_res$wc_df, options_by = NULL)

previous_headings: Multi-omics Integration Visualization Extracting Top Hits
title: Kinograte
code: visualize_network(nodes = kinograte_res$nodes, edges = kinograte_res$edges,                    cluster_df = kinograte_res$wc_df, options_by = "group")

previous_headings: Multi-omics Integration Visualization Extracting Top Hits
title: Kinograte
code: visualize_network(nodes = kinograte_res$nodes, edges = kinograte_res$edges,                    cluster_df = kinograte_res$wc_df, options_by = "cluster") enrichr_res <- network_enrichment(kinograte_res$network) #>   Performing enrichment analysis... #>  #>   Enrichment is being performed by EnrichR (http://amp.pharm.mssm.edu/Enrichr) API ...  reactable(enrichr_res$pathways)

text: R package network-based integration multi-omics datasets. Kinograte designed utilize prize-collecting Steiner forest (PCSF) algorithm. case, goal PCSF algorithm identify simplified sub network representative disease chemical perturbagen.

title: Kinograte: Netwrok-based multi-omics Integration
text: many research questions, insufficient measure transcript protein expression levels. nascent peptides undergo post-translational modification (PTM), gain diverse biological properties integral cell signaling behaviors. Thus, relying exclusively upon gene expression data severely limits ability generate useful scientific insights complex biological systems. Given importance kinome activity signal transduction role many cellular processes like apoptosis cell cycle, becomes clear characterizing kinome signatures conjunction transcriptional proteomics signatures critical understand pathophysiology complex diseases identify novel therapeutic targets. complexity active kinase networks makes interpretation kinomic datasets challenging. Protein kinase signaling work linear fashion (.e alteration kinase activity affects downstream cascades well whole subnetworks interactions, often triggering compensatory responses parts active kinome. learn topic read kinome review paper). Moreover, signature-based drug repurposing promising addition post-translational profiles. Pairing transcriptional profiles (found LINCS) active kinome profiles identify subnetworks can used better understand biological systems highlight optimized drug targets. Kinograte designed focus kinomics particular integrate multi-omics datasets.

what: Integrate omic datasets using PCSF — kinograte
title: Integrate omic datasets using PCSF — kinograte
text: function integrates omic datasets using prize-collecting Steiner forest (PCSF) algorithm

title: Integrate omic datasets using PCSF — kinograte
code: kinograte(   df,   ppi_network,   n = 10,   w = 10,   r = 0.1,   b = 2,   mu = 0.005,   cluster = TRUE,   seed = NULL )

title: Integrate omic datasets using PCSF — kinograte
text: df combined ranked omic datasets ppi_network dataframe protein-protein interactions n integer value determine number runs random noise added edge costs. default value 10. w numeric value tuning number trees output. default value 2. r numeric value determine additional random noise edge costs. random noise upto r percent edge cost added edge. default value 0.1 b numeric value tuning node prizes. default value 1. mu numeric value hub penalization. default value 0.0005. cluster set TRUE cluster network seed (optional) set seed number

title: Integrate omic datasets using PCSF — kinograte
text: list(network, nodes, edges)
